dashboardTool.description: The name of the dashboard tool such as looker, redash etc.

chartId.description: Unique id for the chart. This id should be globally unique for a dashboarding tool even when there are multiple deployments of it. As an example, chart URL could be used here for Looker such as 'looker.linkedin.com/looks/1234'

lastModified.description: Captures information about who created/last modified/deleted this chart and when

chartUrl.description: URL for the chart. This could be used as an external link on DataHub to allow users access/view the chart

inputs.description:
Data sources for the chart
Deprecated! Use inputEdges instead.

lastRefreshed.description: The time when this chart last refreshed

ChangeAuditStamps.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into various lifecycle stages, and who acted to move it into those lifecycle stages. The recommended best practice is to include this record in your record schema, and annotate its fields as @readOnly in your resource. See https://github.com/linkedin/rest.li/wiki/Validation-in-Rest.li#restli-validation-annotations

created.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the creation of this resource/association/sub-resource. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

lastModified.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the last modification of this resource/association/sub-resource. If no modification has happened since creation, lastModified should be the same as created. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

deleted.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the deletion of this resource/association/sub-resource. Logically, deleted MUST have a later timestamp than creation. It may or may not have the same time as lastModified depending upon the resource/association/sub-resource semantics.

AuditStamp.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

time.description: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

actor.description: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

impersonator.description: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

message.description: Additional context around how DataHub was informed of the particular change. For example: was the change created by an automated process, or manually.

Edge.description:
A common structure to represent all edges to entities when used inside aspects as collections
This ensures that all edges have common structure around audit-stamps and will support PATCH, time-travel automatically.

sourceUrn.description:
Urn of the source of this relationship edge.
If not specified, assumed to be the entity that this aspect belongs to.

destinationUrn.description: Urn of the destination of this relationship edge.

created.description: Audit stamp containing who created this relationship edge and when

lastModified.description: Audit stamp containing who last modified this relationship edge and when

properties.description: A generic properties bag that allows us to store specific information on this graph edge.

ChartQuery.description: Information for chart query which is used for getting data of the chart

rawQuery.description: Raw query to build a chart from input datasets

name.description: The URL-encoded name of the AD/LDAP group. Serves as a globally unique identifier within DataHub.

CorpGroupInfo.description: Information about a Corp Group ingested from a third party source

admins.description:
owners of this group
Deprecated! Replaced by Ownership aspect.

members.description:
List of ldap urn in this group.
Deprecated! Replaced by GroupMembership aspect.

groups.description:
List of groups in this group.
Deprecated! This field is unused.

username.description: The name of the AD/LDAP user.

CorpUserEditableInfo.description: Linkedin corp user information that can be edited from UI

aboutMe.description: About me section of the user

teams.description: Teams that the user belongs to e.g. Metadata

skills.description: Skills that the user possesses e.g. Machine Learning

pictureLink.description: A URL which points to a picture which user wants to set as a profile photo

platforms.description: The platforms that the user commonly works with

persona.description: The user's persona type, based on their role

phone.description: Phone number to contact the user

email.description: Email address to contact the user

informationSources.description:
Information sources that have been used to populate this CorpUserEditableInfo.
These include platform resources, such as Slack members or Looker users.
They can also refer to other semantic urns in the future.

active.description: Deprecated! Use CorpUserStatus instead. Whether the corpUser is active, ref: https://iwww.corp.linkedin.com/wiki/cf/display/GTSD/Accessing+Active+Directory+via+LDAP+tools

displayName.description: displayName of this user ,  e.g.  Hang Zhang(DataHQ)

departmentId.description: department id this user belong to

departmentName.description: department name this user belong to

fullName.description: Common name of this user, format is firstName + lastName (split by a whitespace)

countryCode.description: two uppercase letters country code. e.g.  US

system.description: Whether the corpUser is a system user.

CorpUserStatus.description: The status of the user, e.g. provisioned, active, suspended, etc.

status.description: Status of the user, e.g. PROVISIONED / ACTIVE / SUSPENDED

lastModified.description: Audit stamp containing who last modified the status and when.

GroupMembership.description: Carries information about the CorpGroups a user is in.

dashboardTool.description: The name of the dashboard tool such as looker, redash etc.

dashboardId.description: Unique id for the dashboard. This id should be globally unique for a dashboarding tool even when there are multiple deployments of it. As an example, dashboard URL could be used here for Looker such as 'looker.linkedin.com/dashboards/1234'

charts.description:
Charts in a dashboard
Deprecated! Use chartEdges instead.

datasets.description:
Datasets consumed by a dashboard
Deprecated! Use datasetEdges instead.

dashboards.description:
Dashboards included by this dashboard.
Some dashboard entities (e.g. PowerBI Apps) can contain other dashboards.

The Edge's sourceUrn should never be set, as it will always be the base dashboard.

lastModified.description: Captures information about who created/last modified/deleted this dashboard and when

dashboardUrl.description: URL for the dashboard. This could be used as an external link on DataHub to allow users access/view the dashboard

lastRefreshed.description: The time when this dashboard last refreshed

orchestrator.description: Workflow manager like azkaban, airflow which orchestrates the flow

flowId.description: Unique Identifier of the data flow

cluster.description: Cluster where the flow is executed

DataFlowInfo.description: Information about a Data processing flow

project.description: Optional project/namespace associated with the flow

created.description: A timestamp documenting when the asset was created in the source Data Platform (not on DataHub)

lastModified.description: A timestamp documenting when the asset was last modified in the source Data Platform (not on DataHub)

actor.description: Optional: The actor urn involved in the event.

flow.description: Standardized data processing flow urn representing the flow for the job

jobId.description: Unique Identifier of the data job

DataJobInfo.description: Information about a Data processing job

type.description:
Datajob type
*NOTE**: AzkabanJobType is deprecated. Please use strings instead.

flowUrn.description: DataFlow urn that this job is part of

created.description: A timestamp documenting when the asset was created in the source Data Platform (not on DataHub)

lastModified.description: A timestamp documenting when the asset was last modified in the source Data Platform (not on DataHub)

status.description: Status of the job - Deprecated for Data Process Instance model.

DataJobInputOutput.description: Information about the inputs and outputs of a Data processing job

inputDatasets.description:
Input datasets consumed by the data job during processing
Deprecated! Use inputDatasetEdges instead.

inputDatasetEdges.description: Input datasets consumed by the data job during processing

outputDatasets.description:
Output datasets produced by the data job during processing
Deprecated! Use outputDatasetEdges instead.

outputDatasetEdges.description: Output datasets produced by the data job during processing

inputDatajobs.description:
Input datajobs that this data job depends on
Deprecated! Use inputDatajobEdges instead.

inputDatajobEdges.description: Input datajobs that this data job depends on

inputDatasetFields.description: Fields of the input datasets used by this job

outputDatasetFields.description: Fields of the output datasets this job writes to

fineGrainedLineages.description:
Fine-grained column-level lineages
Not currently supported in the UI
Use UpstreamLineage aspect for datasets to express Column Level Lineage for the UI

FineGrainedLineage.description: A fine-grained lineage from upstream fields/datasets to downstream field(s)

transformOperation.description: The transform operation applied to the upstream entities to produce the downstream field(s)

confidenceScore.description: The confidence in this lineage between 0 (low confidence) and 1 (high confidence)

query.description:
The query that was used to generate this lineage. 
Present only if the lineage was generated from a detected query.

FineGrainedLineageUpstreamType.description: The type of upstream entity in a fine-grained lineage

FineGrainedLineageDownstreamType.description: The type of downstream field(s) in a fine-grained lineage

DatasetDeprecation.description:
Dataset deprecation status
Deprecated! This aspect is deprecated in favor of the more-general-purpose 'Deprecation' aspect.

deprecated.description: Whether the dataset is deprecated by owner.

decommissionTime.description: The time user plan to decommission this dataset.

note.description: Additional information about the dataset deprecation plan, such as the wiki, doc, RB.

actor.description: The corpuser URN which will be credited for modifying this deprecation content.

uri.description: The abstracted URI such as hdfs:///data/tracking/PageViewEvent, file:///dir/file_name. Uri should not include any environment specific properties. Some datasets might not have a standardized uri, which makes this field optional (i.e. kafka topic).

created.description: A timestamp documenting when the asset was created in the source Data Platform (not on DataHub)

lastModified.description: A timestamp documenting when the asset was last modified in the source Data Platform (not on DataHub)

tags.description:
[Legacy] Unstructured tags for the dataset. Structured tags can be applied via the `GlobalTags` aspect.
This is now deprecated.

upstreams.description: List of upstream dataset lineage information

fineGrainedLineages.description: List of fine-grained lineage information, including field-level lineage

Upstream.description: Upstream lineage information about a dataset including the source reporting the lineage

auditStamp.description: Audit stamp containing who reported the lineage and when.

created.description: Audit stamp containing who created the lineage and when.

dataset.description: The upstream dataset the lineage points to

properties.description: A generic properties bag that allows us to store specific information on this graph edge.

query.description: If the lineage is generated by a query, a reference to the query

DatasetLineageType.description: The various types of supported dataset lineage

SchemaMetadata.description: SchemaMetadata to describe metadata related to store schema

schemaName.description: Schema name e.g. PageViewEvent, identity.Profile, ams.account_management_tracking

platform.description: Standardized platform urn where schema is defined. The data platform Urn (urn:li:platform:{platform_name})

version.description: Every change to SchemaMetadata in the resource results in a new version. Version is server assigned. This version is differ from platform native schema version.

created.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the creation of this resource/association/sub-resource. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

lastModified.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the last modification of this resource/association/sub-resource. If no modification has happened since creation, lastModified should be the same as created. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

deleted.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the deletion of this resource/association/sub-resource. Logically, deleted MUST have a later timestamp than creation. It may or may not have the same time as lastModified depending upon the resource/association/sub-resource semantics.

dataset.description: Dataset this schema metadata is associated with.

cluster.description: The cluster this schema metadata resides from

hash.description: the SHA1 hash of the schema content

platformSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform.

fields.description: Client provided a list of fields from document schema.

primaryKeys.description: Client provided list of fields that define primary keys to access record. Field order defines hierarchical espresso keys. Empty lists indicates absence of primary key access patter. Value is a SchemaField@fieldPath.

foreignKeysSpecs.description: Map captures all the references schema makes to external datasets. Map key is ForeignKeySpecName typeref.

foreignKeys.description: List of foreign key constraints for the schema

EspressoSchema.description: Schema text of an espresso table schema.

OracleDDL.description: Schema holder for oracle data definition language that describes an oracle table.

tableSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform. This is a human readable (json blob) table schema.

MySqlDDL.description: Schema holder for MySql data definition language that describes an MySql table.

tableSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform. This is a human readable (json blob) table schema.

PrestoDDL.description: Schema holder for presto data definition language that describes a presto view.

rawSchema.description: The raw schema in the dataset's platform. This includes the DDL and the columns extracted from DDL.

documentSchema.description: The native kafka document schema. This is a human readable avro document schema.

documentSchemaType.description: The native kafka document schema type. This can be AVRO/PROTOBUF/JSON.

keySchema.description: The native kafka key schema as retrieved from Schema Registry

keySchemaType.description: The native kafka key schema type. This can be AVRO/PROTOBUF/JSON.

BinaryJsonSchema.description: Schema text of binary JSON schema.

schema.description: The native schema text for binary JSON file format.

OrcSchema.description: Schema text of an ORC schema.

schema.description: The native schema for ORC file format.

KeyValueSchema.description: Schema text of a key-value store schema.

keySchema.description: The raw schema for the key in the key-value store.

valueSchema.description: The raw schema for the value in the key-value store.

OtherSchema.description: Schema holder for undefined schema types.

rawSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform.

SchemaField.description: SchemaField to describe metadata related to dataset schema.

fieldPath.description: Flattened name of the field. Field is computed from jsonPath field.

jsonPath.description: Flattened name of a field in JSON Path notation.

nullable.description: Indicates if this field is optional or nullable

label.description:
Label of the field. Provides a more human-readable name for the field than field path. Some sources will
provide this metadata but not all sources have the concept of a label. If just one string is associated with
a field in a source, that is most likely a description.

Note that this field is deprecated and is not surfaced in the UI.

created.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the creation of this schema field.

lastModified.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the last modification of this schema field.

type.description: Platform independent field type of the field.

nativeDataType.description: The native type of the field in the dataset's platform as declared by platform schema.

recursive.description: There are use cases when a field in type B references type A. A field in A references field of type B. In such cases, we will mark the first field as recursive.

glossaryTerms.description: Glossary terms associated with the field

isPartOfKey.description:
For schema fields that are part of complex keys, set this field to true
We do this to easily distinguish between value and key fields

isPartitioningKey.description:
For Datasets which are partitioned, this determines the partitioning key.
Note that multiple columns can be part of a partitioning key, but currently we do not support
rendering the ordered partitioning key.

jsonProps.description:
For schema fields that have other properties that are not modeled explicitly,
use this field to serialize those properties into a JSON string

valueType.description: Type of the value in a map

nestedType.description: List of types this array holds.

nestedTypes.description: List of types in union type.

GlobalTags.description: Tag aspect used for applying tags to an entity

tags.description: Tags associated with a given entity

TagAssociation.description:
Properties of an applied tag. For now, just an Urn. In the future we can extend this with other properties, e.g.
propagation parameters.

attribution.description: Information about who, why, and how this metadata was applied

MetadataAttribution.description: Information about who, why, and how this metadata was applied

actor.description:
The entity (e.g. a member URN) responsible for applying the assocated metadata. This can
either be a user (in case of UI edits) or the datahub system for automation.

source.description:
The DataHub source responsible for applying the associated metadata. This will only be filled out
when a DataHub source is responsible. This includes the specific metadata test urn, the automation urn.

sourceDetail.description:
The details associated with why this metadata was applied. For example, this could include
the actual regex rule, sql statement, ingestion pipeline ID, etc.

auditStamp.description: Audit stamp containing who reported the related business term

GlossaryTermAssociation.description: Properties of an applied glossary term.

urn.description: Urn of the applied glossary term

actor.description: The user URN which will be credited for adding associating this term to the entity

attribution.description: Information about who, why, and how this metadata was applied

ForeignKeySpec.description: Description of a foreign key in a schema.

foreignKey.description: Foreign key definition in metadata schema.

currentFieldPaths.description: List of fields in hosting(current) SchemaMetadata that conform a foreign key. List can contain a single entry or multiple entries if several entries in hosting schema conform a foreign key in a single parent dataset.

parentField.description: SchemaField@fieldPath that uniquely identify field in parent dataset that this field references.

UrnForeignKey.description: If SchemaMetadata fields make any external references and references are of type com.linkedin.common.Urn or any children, this models can be used to mark it.

ForeignKeyConstraint.description: Description of a foreign key constraint in a schema.

name.description: Name of the constraint, likely provided from the source

foreignFields.description: Fields the constraint maps to on the foreign dataset

sourceFields.description: Fields the constraint maps to on the source dataset

foreignDataset.description: Reference to the foreign dataset for ease of lookup

EditableSchemaMetadata.description:
EditableSchemaMetadata stores editable changes made to schema metadata. This separates changes made from
ingestion pipelines and edits in the UI to avoid accidental overwrites of user-provided data by ingestion pipelines.

created.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the creation of this resource/association/sub-resource. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

lastModified.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the last modification of this resource/association/sub-resource. If no modification has happened since creation, lastModified should be the same as created. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

deleted.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the deletion of this resource/association/sub-resource. Logically, deleted MUST have a later timestamp than creation. It may or may not have the same time as lastModified depending upon the resource/association/sub-resource semantics.

editableSchemaFieldInfo.description: Client provided a list of fields from document schema.

EditableSchemaFieldInfo.description: SchemaField to describe metadata related to dataset schema.

fieldPath.description: FieldPath uniquely identifying the SchemaField this metadata is associated with

glossaryTerms.description: Glossary terms associated with the field

InstitutionalMemory.description: Institutional memory of an entity. This is a way to link to relevant documentation and provide description of the documentation. Institutional or tribal knowledge is very important for users to leverage the entity.

elements.description: List of records that represent institutional memory of an entity. Each record consists of a link, description, creator and timestamps associated with that record.

InstitutionalMemoryMetadata.description: Metadata corresponding to a record of institutional memory.

url.description: Link to an engineering design document or a wiki page.

createStamp.description: Audit stamp associated with creation of this record

updateStamp.description: Audit stamp associated with updation of this record

InstitutionalMemoryMetadataSettings.description: Settings related to a record of InstitutionalMemoryMetadata

showInAssetPreview.description: Show record in asset preview like on entity header and search previews

parentNode.description: Parent node of the glossary term
Parent node of the glossary term

termSource.description: Source of the Business Term (INTERNAL or EXTERNAL) with default value as INTERNAL

rawSchema.description: Schema definition of the glossary term

name.description: The term name, which serves as a unique id

VersionTag.description: A resource-defined string representing the resource state for the purpose of concurrency control

platform.description: Standardized platform urn for the model

origin.description: Fabric type where model belongs to or where it was generated

CaveatsAndRecommendations.description: This section should list additional concerns that were not covered in the previous sections. For example, did the results suggest any further testing? Were there any relevant groups that were not represented in the evaluation dataset? Are there additional recommendations for model use?

caveats.description: This section should list additional concerns that were not covered in the previous sections. For example, did the results suggest any further testing? Were there any relevant groups that were not represented in the evaluation dataset?

recommendations.description: Recommendations on where this MLModel should be used.

idealDatasetCharacteristics.description: Ideal characteristics of an evaluation dataset for this MLModel

CaveatDetails.description: This section should list additional concerns that were not covered in the previous sections. For example, did the results suggest any further testing? Were there any relevant groups that were not represented in the evaluation dataset? Are there additional recommendations for model use?

needsFurtherTesting.description: Did the results suggest any further testing?

caveatDescription.description:
Caveat Description
For ex: Given gender classes are binary (male/not male), which we include as male/female. Further work needed to evaluate across a spectrum of genders.

groupsNotRepresented.description: Relevant groups that were not represented in the evaluation dataset?

EthicalConsiderations.description: This section is intended to demonstrate the ethical considerations that went into MLModel development, surfacing ethical challenges and solutions to stakeholders.

data.description: Does the MLModel use any sensitive data (e.g., protected classes)?

humanLife.description: Is the MLModel intended to inform decisions about matters central to human life or flourishing - e.g., health or safety? Or could it be used in such a way?

mitigations.description: What risk mitigation strategies were used during MLModel development?

risksAndHarms.description: What risks may be present in MLModel usage? Try to identify the potential recipients, likelihood, and magnitude of harms. If these cannot be determined, note that they were considered but remain unknown.

useCases.description: Are there any known MLModel use cases that are especially fraught? This may connect directly to the intended use section

EvaluationData.description: All referenced datasets would ideally point to any set of documents that provide visibility into the source and composition of the dataset.

evaluationData.description: Details on the dataset(s) used for the quantitative analyses in the MLModel

dataset.description: What dataset were used in the MLModel?

preProcessing.description: How was the data preprocessed (e.g., tokenization of sentences, cropping of images, any filtering such as dropping images without faces)?

IntendedUse.description: Intended Use for the ML Model

primaryUses.description: Primary Use cases for the MLModel.

primaryUsers.description: Primary Intended Users - For example, was the MLModel developed for entertainment purposes, for hobbyists, or enterprise solutions?

outOfScopeUses.description: Highlight technology that the MLModel might easily be confused with, or related contexts that users could try to apply the MLModel to.

Metrics.description: Metrics to be featured for the MLModel.

MLModelFactorPrompts.description: Prompts which affect the performance of the MLModel

relevantFactors.description: What are foreseeable salient factors for which MLModel performance may vary, and how were these determined?

evaluationFactors.description: Which factors are being reported, and why were these chosen?

MLModelFactors.description: Factors affecting the performance of the MLModel.

groups.description:
Groups refers to distinct categories with similar characteristics that are present in the evaluation data instances.
For human-centric machine learning MLModels, groups are people who share one or multiple characteristics.

instrumentation.description:
The performance of a MLModel can vary depending on what instruments were used to capture the input to the MLModel.
For example, a face detection model may perform differently depending on the camera's hardware and software,
including lens, image stabilization, high dynamic range techniques, and background blurring for portrait mode.

environment.description: A further factor affecting MLModel performance is the environment in which it is deployed.

MLModelProperties.description: Properties associated with a ML Model

trainingJobs.description: List of jobs or process instances (if any) used to train the model or group. Visible in Lineage. Note that ML Models can also be specified as the output of a specific Data Process Instances (runs) via the DataProcessInstanceOutputs aspect.

downstreamJobs.description: List of jobs or process instances (if any) that use the model or group.

date.description: Date when the MLModel was developed

created.description: Audit stamp containing who created this and when

lastModified.description: Date when the MLModel was last modified

type.description: Type of Algorithm or MLModel such as whether it is a Naive Bayes classifier, Convolutional Neural Network, etc

hyperParameters.description:
Hyper Parameters of the MLModel

NOTE: these are deprecated in favor of hyperParams

trainingMetrics.description: Metrics of the MLModel used in training

onlineMetrics.description: Metrics of the MLModel used in production

mlFeatures.description: List of features used for MLModel training

MLHyperParam.description: Properties associated with an ML Hyper Param

createdAt.description: Date when the MLHyperParam was developed

MLMetric.description: Properties associated with an ML Metric

createdAt.description: Date when the mlMetric was developed

QuantitativeAnalyses.description: Quantitative analyses should be disaggregated, that is, broken down by the chosen factors. Quantitative analyses should provide the results of evaluating the MLModel according to the chosen metrics, providing confidence interval values when possible.

unitaryResults.description: Link to a dashboard with results showing how the MLModel performed with respect to each factor

intersectionalResults.description: Link to a dashboard with results showing how the MLModel performed with respect to the intersection of evaluated factors?

TrainingData.description: Ideally, the MLModel card would contain as much information about the training data as the evaluation data. However, there might be cases where it is not feasible to provide this level of detailed information about the training data. For example, the data may be proprietary, or require a non-disclosure agreement. In these cases, we advocate for basic details about the distributions over groups in the data, as well as any other details that could inform stakeholders on the kinds of biases the model may have encoded.

trainingData.description: Details on the dataset(s) used for training the MLModel

name.description: The tag name, which serves as a unique id

colorHex.description: The color associated with the Tag in Hex. For example #FFFFFF.

owners.description: List of owners of the entity.

ownerTypes.description: Ownership type to Owners map, populated via mutation hook.

lastModified.description: Audit stamp containing who last modified the record and when. A value of 0 in the time field indicates missing data.

owner.description:
Owner URN, e.g. urn:li:corpuser:ldap, urn:li:corpGroup:group_name, and urn:li:multiProduct:mp_name
(Caveat: only corpuser is currently supported in the frontend.)

typeUrn.description:
The type of the ownership
Urn of type O

attribution.description: Information about who, why, and how this metadata was applied

url.description: A reference URL for the source

Status.description:
The lifecycle status metadata of an entity, e.g. dataset, metric, feature, etc.
This aspect is used to represent soft deletes conventionally.

removed.description: Whether the entity has been removed (soft-deleted).

BrowsePaths.description: Shared aspect containing Browse Paths to be indexed for an entity.

paths.description:
A list of valid browse paths for the entity.

Browse paths are expected to be forward slash-separated strings. For example: 'prod/snowflake/datasetName'

DataPlatformInstance.description: The specific instance of the data platform that this entity belongs to

instance.description: Instance of the data platform (e.g. db instance)
